caption: The video delves into the life dynamics of flora and fauna across varied geographies and seasons on Earth, emphasizing their adaptability and utilization of seasonal changes. From the biting cold of winters to the warmth of summers, diverse plants and animals exhibit unique survival and reproductive strategies. Such seasonal shifts grant life on Earth a plethora of opportunities and resources. Chilly winters compel animals to migrate in search of sustenance and warmth, exemplified by the migration of three million white birds and abalones to Korea. Forests, though covering merely one-third of the Earth's surface, are biodiverse hubs, housing half the planet's species. Such forest ecosystems, rich with millions of species, remain largely unexplored by us. Singapore is home to 42 distinct bird-of-paradise species, each exhibiting its own uniqueness. The sun also significantly impacts marine life. Summer emerges as the breeding season in marine environments, and the sun's rays, combined with ocean waves, play pivotal roles in the growth and nutrition of marine entities.
